data.note: This is the figure stated in the country's Grid Extension Strategy of 2011. It mentions the reliance on donor aid funding (65% of the total, or $45.5m). How much is actually available for rural electrification is unclear. FUNAE's most recent annual report gives a figure of $30.5m for off-grid projects (excluding grid extension).
data.name: Rural electrification budget

data.note: This price only applies to new connections in grid-connected areas, such as where neigbouring houses are connected to the grid. For connections further from the grid, the utility EDM requires a guaranteed minimum volume of electricity consumption per 100 metres of new transmission line.
data.name: New connection cost
